reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Inter-American Network of Corporate Foundations and Actions for Grassroots Development

description.narrative: Fundación Arcor, $168,000 for the first year of a three year agreement. Fundación Arcor will provide small grants, training and other support to community organizations of poor people to carry out local self-help development projects. Fundación Arcor will also provide leadership and coordination to a learning initiative involving some two dozen corporate foundations and companies that are members of the Inter- American Network of Corporate Foundations and Actions for Grassroots Development. (CP-003)

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: U.S. assistance in Argentina promotes regional stability and nonproliferation, and enhances opportunities for mutually beneficial economic initiatives. The Argentine government's approaches towards international peacekeeping operations (PKO), the nonproliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and counterterrorism are welcome developments. Although the previous Kirchner government placed substantial constraints on security, counternarcotics, and law enforcement cooperation in recent years, the new government, which took office on December 10, has signaled very clearly that it seeks much more robust cooperation with the United States on all of these issues.
